alert.note: Alert for Haskell; Le Flore; Sequoyah (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 21 at 9:20PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Haskell, southeastern Sequoyah and northern Le Flore Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 920 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northwest of Keota to 4 miles northeast of Fanshawe. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations in or near the path include... Poteau... Pocola... Muldrow... Roland... Spiro... Arkoma... Panama... Keota... Mccurtain... Bokoshe... Gans... Cameron... Moffett... Mc Curtain... Shady Point... Rock Island... Cowlington... Kanima... Scullyville... Braden... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 315 and 328. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for southeastern Oklahoma.
